dt: {bc}to relieve of a charge, load, or burden:
{bc}to release electrical energy from (something, such as a battery or capacitor) by a discharge {dx_def}see {dxt|discharge:2||9b}{/dx_def}
{bc}to release from confinement, custody, or care

dt.t: had to {wi}discharge{/wi} several employees last month

dt: {bc}to get rid of (something, such as a debt or obligation) by performing an appropriate action (such as payment)
{bc}to order (a legislative committee) to end consideration of a bill {dx_def}see {dxt|bill:4||6}{/dx_def} in order to bring it before the house {dx_def}see {dxt|house:1||6a}{/dx_def} for action
{bc}to bear and distribute (something, such as the weight of a wall above an opening)
{bc}to bleach out or remove (color or dye) in dyeing and printing {d_link|textiles|textile}
{bc}to cancel the record of the loan of (a library book) upon return
{bc}to throw off or deliver a load, charge, or burden
{bc}to release electrical energy by a discharge {dx_def}see {dxt|discharge:2||9b}{/dx_def}
{bc}to pour forth fluid or other contents

dt.t: where the river {wi}discharges{/wi} into the ocean

pt: {sc}perform{/sc} {sc}execute{/sc} {sc}discharge{/sc} {sc}accomplish{/sc} {sc}achieve{/sc} {sc}effect{/sc} {sc}fulfill{/sc} mean to carry out or into effect. {sc}perform{/sc} implies action that follows established patterns or procedures or fulfills agreed-upon requirements and often connotes special skill.
{sc}execute{/sc} stresses the carrying out of what exists in plan or in intent.
{sc}discharge{/sc} implies execution and completion of appointed duties or tasks.
{sc}accomplish{/sc} stresses the successful completion of a process rather than the means of carrying it out.

pt.t: {it}accomplished{/it} everything they set out to do

pt: {sc}achieve{/sc} adds to {sc}accomplish{/sc} the implication of conquered difficulties.
{sc}effect{/sc} adds to {sc}achieve{/sc} an emphasis on the inherent force in the agent capable of surmounting obstacles.
{sc}fulfill{/sc} implies a complete realization of ends or possibilities.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}descharger{/it}, from Late Latin {it}discarricare{/it}, from Latin {it}dis-{/it} + Late Latin {it}carricare{/it} to load {ma}{mat|charge:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to relieve of a charge, load, or burden:

dt: {bc}the act of relieving of something that {d_link|oppresses|oppress} {bc}{sx|release||}
{bc}the state of being discharged or relieved

dt.t: a clear {wi}discharge{/wi} from the eyes and nose

dt: {bc}the act of removing an obligation or liability {dx_def}see {dxt|liability||2}{/dx_def}

dt.t: received a full {wi}discharge{/wi} from his creditors

dt: {bc}release or dismissal especially from an office or employment
{bc}the equalization of a difference of electric potential {dx_def}see {dxt|potential:2||2c}{/dx_def} between two points
{bc}the conversion of the chemical energy of a battery into electrical energy

shortdef: the act of relieving of something that oppresses : release
something that discharges or releases; especially : a certification of release or payment
the state of being discharged or relieved

dt: {bc}an electric lamp in which an enclosed gas or vapor glows or causes a phosphor coating on the lamp's inner surface to glow

shortdef: an electric lamp in which an enclosed gas or vapor glows or causes a phosphor coating on the lamp's inner surface to glow

dt: {bc}an electron tube which contains gas or vapor at low pressure and through which conduction takes place when a high voltage is applied

shortdef: an electron tube which contains gas or vapor at low pressure and through which conduction takes place when a high voltage is applied

dt: {bc}a faintly luminous relatively slow electrical discharge having no spark

shortdef: a faintly luminous relatively slow electrical discharge having no spark

dt: {bc}a luminous electrical discharge without sparks through a gas

shortdef: a luminous electrical discharge without sparks through a gas

dt: {bc}the ending of a person's service to the military because of unacceptable behavior

dt.t: Her military career ended with a {it}dishonorable discharge{/it}.

shortdef: the ending of a person's service to the military because of unacceptable behavior

dt: {bc}occurring before {d_link|discharge|discharge:2} (such as discharge from military service or the discharge of a debt)

dt.t: All debtors must attend a two-hour course on managing finances in order to receive a bankruptcy discharge. This is sometimes referred to as budget counseling, debtor education, or {wi}predischarge{/wi} counseling.

shortdef: occurring before discharge (such as discharge from military service or the discharge of a debt)
